DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Text Chemotherapy Therapeutic Procedure Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text area for manual documentation of information regarding chemotherapy treatment of the reported tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Manual documentation of information regarding chemotherapy treatment of the reported tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term is used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, particularly, it refers to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer. Antineoplastic chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells. Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
